- Seen a book your friend would like? You can now share it with them. Just send them a recommendation and they'll be able to start reading it right away.
- We've reskinned our emoji keyboard with a fresh new face. Same impressions. Same emoji. Better looking.
- You can now edit advanced reading settings direct from each book. No need to backtrack and alter them in profile settings.
- Your library now loads faster. Less waiting. More reading.
- It's now possible to edit book descriptions on each of your bookshelves – much more convenient than before.
- And we fixed a few more bugs. Standard protocol :)
We’ve fixed the chapter navigation issue and squashed some other little bugs.
Our previous version had a few bugs. Sorry about that. All fixed now – check out the new version.

- Yay! We’ve added a comment feature. Go discuss interesting books!
- Refer your friends to Bookmate and get a free two week Premium subscription for each one that subscribes!
- We’ve stamped on a few more bugs; squelching them into oblivion.

Great news!
— It’s now even easier to read comments in Bookmate. Just open a book, quote, or impression and join in the discussion!
— Reading something in its original language? Stuck on a word or phrase? Use our built-in translation service!
— We’ve also fixed some small but annoying bugs.

— No more notification overloads! Next time you get 1,000 likes in ten minutes you’ll only hear from us once.
— You can now navigate Bookmate in German. Herzliche Grüße an unsere deutschen Leser!
— We’ve fixed a few bugs. Standard.

- Now you can add your books to Bookmate right from your phone. Open a file in the fb2 or epub format and choose Bookmate in the menu ‘Open with…’.
- We can now recognize existing readers by email address, phone, and login details. So if make a few typos when logging in – don’t worry – we won’t create new account for you!
- We’ve smartened up our search. Find whatever book you need – pronto!
- We’ve also fixed iPad registration and a few other minor bugs.

The latest update has a host of iOS 10 features:
+ Our iMessage application lets you easily share books, quotes, impressions, and bookshelves.
+ Keep the books you’re reading open, keep track of what you plan to read next, and easily find new books with our updated Bookmate widget.
+ Get a faster app experience, thanks to new iOS 10 rich notifications.

We've also added Turkish and Portuguese as interface languages, fixed some minor bugs, and improved overall app stability.

Now it’s even easier to find funny, sad, intriguing, captivating, and all-round interesting books!

We’ve improved our search experience – meaning you’ll never miss out on great books and new releases. Plus we’ve streamlined our ‘search by author’ function. Also, every author now has their own page.

Thanks to ongoing user feedback, we’ve fixed a few bugs and improved overall app stability. Good work team :)

In the new version, you can change the way pages are numbered in the reader. To do this, click the page number and select your preferred numbering option: individual numbers (eg 1), page progress in numbers (eg 1 of 1,000), or page progress in percentage (eg 1%). You can also remove page numbering completely – in the reader settings.

We’ve also updated the ‘impressions’ screen and corrected some minor errors to ensure Bookmate works faster and is much more stable.

In the new version of the app you can choose to save your books in ‘Settings’ – or remove them to save space.
 
We’ve updated the built-in translator too. Bookmate now automatically remembers the language used for each title; so you no longer need to manually set this up. Also translations have become more detailed and sophisticated.
 
The app now supports audiobooks for CarPlay. You can also connect to Siri Shortcuts in iOS 12 and manage Bookmate through voice commands.

— You can now schedule the reader theme to switch to night mode automatically – at a specific time. Alternatively, night mode will switch on when the screen brightness adjusts due to external light reduction.
— The translator now automatically determines the language of any word you want to translate
— Code blocks are now better displayed in programming books
— We solved the “notch” (black bar obscuring the top of each book) problem for readers using an iPhone X Max

The new version of Bookmate offers two new features: a dark theme and bookmark functionality.

To prevent your eyes from tiring when reading in dimming light, you can now choose to read light text against a dark background. Give it a try as the nights get longer! If your app is dark by default after the update, it means Bookmate has automatically set to the colour of your iOS. You can restore the usual background colour in the settings.

You can now add bookmarks to your books! Easily pick up where you left off with this handy feature. To bookmark a page in flip mode, slide the screen up with your finger. In scroll mode, just slide it to the left. Bookmarks are stored along with your quotes. To view them, tap the icon in the lower right hand corner of the reader.

In this new version we have improved the reader scrolling: Moving from one part of a book to another is now even simpler.

And now you can also freely bookmark what you read! If you’re in page-flipping mode, you can pull the screen up. If you’re in scroll mode, you can pull the screen to the left. All bookmarks are saved together with your quotes. To view them, tap the icon in the lower right corner of the reader.

In this version, we’ve updated the “My Books” section to make it easier to navigate.
The book you’re currently reading is now visible at the top of the screen. You can even see the exact fragment where you left off. Any books and audiobooks that you’re currently reading and listening to at the same time are shown at the bottom of the screen – under the heading “Still reading”.
The list of all the books that you’ve added to your library is now called “I want to read”. It can be filtered by type (books, audiobooks, and comic books), genre, and author.
The shelves you’re subscribed to can also be found in “My books”. Here we’ve also added a section with all the downloaded books that you can read and listen to offline.
If any book is not yet available in our library, you can click on the “Track availability” button and we’ll let you know when it arrives.

What's new
• The search tab has changed. Books are now grouped by topic and genre to make it easier for you to find titles you’ll enjoy .

What's been fixed
• The audio player's motion intervals bug has been fixed. To reset them, go to settings and adjust the  parameters .
Thanks to your ongoing feedback, we’ve fixed a few more bugs and improved overall app stability.

What's new
• Don’t feel like reading? Listen instead! If a book or series has an audio version, you’ll find it on the same page, just below the eBook listing. 

Corrections
• The books in your lists will once again open up when tapped on.
• For those short on time, we’ve returned the 3x speed to the audiobook player.
• If listening to an audiobook in CarPlay, your progress will no longer be reset
• Once you’ve deleted a book, it won’t reappear in your library. Ever (some did before, but they absolutely won’t now).
• Your bookmarks will be featured exactly where you put them as well as on the last page.

What's fixed
• The application will consume your device's battery much less if you listen to books in iOS background mode.
• Texts of quotations in the notebook are displayed in full. Highlight 5 words or 50, none is lost.
• The application will no longer ask you to rate its work so often. Your opinion is really important to us, but we will be less invasive.

What's new?
• Listen to a book or read one? Why not do both? Turn on the audio in the background and follow the text in the reader – both functions work simultaneously.

What's fixed?
• The audio player timer had a hidden function: "Listen to the end of the chapter". But no more hiding! Now we’re putting it pride of place – clear for all users to see.
• The app no longer ​​freezes when you add a book to the shelf.
• If you’re reading a book series without the Internet, and later go back online, your reading progress will be saved. No issues.

In addition to the worst bugs, we fixed a few more. They’re almost invisible, but you will enjoy using the audio player a lot more now. Thanks for the feedback!

What's been fixed
 • Ironically, our tooltips weren’t proving very helpful!. Now they appear at the right place, at the right time.
 • Enter a title in the search bar and you’ll see all books, audiobooks, comics, and podcasts based on your request. No more guesswork!
